numbered_ace_sentences: 1. More people who are 15-24 years old agree that the world is getting better and better.
2. The younger generations may be more optimistic than the older generations.
3. I wonder why the brains of younger people think in this way.
4. Younger people may have seen less than older people.
5. This topic relates to my school community.
6. All people in my school community are 15-24 years old.
7. People in my school community may feel in the same way.
8. The graph shows a difference between adults and teenagers and young adults.
9. The graph shows that adults and teenagers and young adults think differently about the world.
10. Younger people say more often than adults that the world is getting better with each generation.
11. A headline can be: Is the world really getting better?
12. A headline can be: How do humans really feel about our world?
